abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Shanghai Sewerage Project
            (SSPII) will involve a reclamation project at the
            Bailonggang to improve the water environment of the Huangpu
            River, protect the water quality of the upper Huangpu water
            supply intake, and speed up the development of Pudong New
            Area. This supplemental statement of environmental impact
            assessment came as a result of the changing of land
            acquisition option for the sewerage treatment plant, which
            may change the result from the original environmental
            assessment done in 1995 (E127). Filling spoil left from the
            reclamation project will be used to build the Bailonggang
            embankment. To mitigate the impact of dust, spoil stockpiles
            and roads will be regularly sprinkled with water. To reduce
            noise from the vehicles for spoil transportation, roads and
            bridges will be widened and harnessed to accelerate the
            speed of transportation. During the construction period,
            wastewater must be discharged into septic tank and then
            carried away regularly by local sanitation department. Odor
            generated from wastewater process will be mitigated by
            laying sewerage discharge pipes, and utilizing land to plant
            trees and conduct greenery projects. Compensation will be
            arranged to tackle the economic loss of the fishermen and
            farmers affected duirng the construction.
